thread.title: SOCCER: Pioneers breeze into title game
thread.title_full: SOCCER: Pioneers breeze into title game

author: HANSON CRAFTON
title: SOCCER: Pioneers breeze into title game
text:
Staff photo by Greg Mengelt Emma Roesner 
Providence senior Emma Roesner had 35 goals and nine assists to help lead the Pioneers to a 17-3 season. Posted: Thursday, October 8, 2015 11:31 pm SOCCER: Pioneers breeze into title game By HANSON CRAFTON News and Tribune 
FERDINAND — With a 7-0 win over Salem on Thursday, Providence advanced to the Class A Forest Park Sectional Championship on Saturday. Providence will take on Heritage Hills, which knocked off the host Rangers 4-1. 
Emma Roesner and the Pioneers jumped all over Salem with six goals in the first half. They scored their first goal in the first 30 seconds of the game. They followed with two more in the next 15 minutes. 
Roesner finished with a hat trick, making sure she played for a sectional title in her senior year. Bailey Barron led the team with two assists in the big win. 
“It was a good, clean soccer match,” Providence coach Dave Smith said. “We were able to put a lot of pressure on Salem early. We were very unselfish with the ball and out shots were dropping.” 
CLASS A FOREST PARK SECTIONAL 
SEMIFINAL 
PROVIDENCE 7, NORTH HARRISON 0 
PROVIDENCE STATISTICS 
Goals: Emma Roesner 3, Bailey Brown, Jacqueline Scott, Taylor WIlliams, Skylar Richey, Kayley Hoke. 
Assists: Bailey Barron 2, Taylor Williams, Olivia Dome. 
Saves: Katrina Cooper 2, Molly Koetter 2. 
BOYS' SOCCER 
MITCHELL KNOCKS OFF HENRYVILLE 
MITCHELL — Henryville suffered a tough 7-3 loss on Thursday to the Mitchell Bluejackets. Mitchell beat the Hornets 7-3 in the semifinals of the Mitchell Sectional. 
Henryville ran into a wall in the form of Mitchell’s Josh Duncan. Duncan had a massive game with six goals. 
Henryvilles’ Jacob Janek didn’t leave empty handed. The Hornets leading scorer scored three times in the loss, finishing the season in style with a hat trick. 
Mitchell got off to a fast start against the Hornets. The Jackets scored their first goal in the second minute of the game, and 17 minutes later, they enjoyed a 4-0 lead. 
Janek got Henryville on the board before the half and then scored again to start the second half with a penalty kick. Henryville looked to be picking up momentum, but Mitchell put an end to the Hornet run and responded with a 3-1 run to close the game. 
Mitchell advances to the Sectional final Saturday. It will meet the Rock Creek Lions, who are coming off of win over Salem in penalty kicks on Tuesday. 
CLASS A MITCHELL SECTIONAL
